Posted By: mdakw576 (12/21/2009 12:05:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Historical note: Back in the day, Floodgate made a wonderful, recurring creature-sweeper when combined with any card that could cause it to phase out, such as [Vanishing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vanishing). Unfortunately, that combo became obsolete when WotC changed the definition of phasing, such that phasing no longer triggers leaves-play effects.
posts.html:

This card has the coolest flavor... amazing. It actually acts like a dam, and does more damage the more water it "holds back".
  
   
Brilliant concept, even if it isn't an incredible card.
  
   
5/5

It certainly is odd that blue creature has an effect that damage other creatures.  
Sadly it only occurs when it leaves play making the creature unstable.

Posted By: Hoonster (3/4/2011 4:40:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If i'd be Mahkt i'd be upset to know that i'm only refered to as 'goblin casualty' :D That's a pretty weird title to have:  
"Dad, what profession did gramps actually have when he was your age?"  
-"Your grandfather was a proud goblin casualty, Billy!"  
  
Oh, and although [Vanishing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vanishing) regrettably doesn't work anymore, it still works with bounce effects, e.g. with [Trusted Advisor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trusted Advisor). Obvious downside it that you have to pay its mana cost each time you want to drown some creatures.

posts.post_content:
Confession: It took me longer than it should have to figure out the *point* of this wall was to [jump](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=jump) it. At first I thought the "bury it" clause was supposed to be some kind of bizarre drawback.  
  
Just for fun, pair with [Flood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flood), which lets you tap a creature for each two islands you control. :)
